image.altText: Finances generic

props.synopsis: The latest quarterly inflation data shows core inflation has dropped to its lowest level in years, increasing hopes the Reserve Bank will cut rates in February. A rally on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks higher. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Core inflation drops, increasing chances of rate cut in February, ASX rises

image.altText: Escalators at Carindale shopping centre busy with Christmas shoppers

props.synopsis: Financial markets are betting the Reserve Bank will preview a rates reprieve in February, with official figures showing the RBA's preferred measure of inflation fell to 3.2 per cent over the year to December.

title.children: 'Cut baby cut!' Chances of interest rate cut increase as inflation slows

image.altText: A little girl with a pink cap, smiling

props.synopsis: All 14 members of a fringe religious group have been found guilty of the manslaughter of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs, who died after her insulin was withheld.

title.children: Religious group members who trusted God to heal 8yo diabetic convicted

image.altText: Two men sitting on a table speaking.

props.synopsis: Liang Wenfeng is now leading China in its AI revolution as the superpower attempts to keep pace with the dominant AI industry in the United States. But who is the founder of DeepSeek?

title.children: Who is Liang Wenfeng, the founder of AI chatbot DeepSeek?

image.altText: Steve Smith and Dhananjaya de Silva shake hands before Australia and Sri Lanka's cricket Test series.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith will captain Australia in Pat Cummins's absence, with a reshuffled line-up set to take on Sri Lanka in the first of two Tests in Galle. Follow live.

title.children: Smith back leading new-look Aussie XI in first Test against Sri Lanka

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia to bat first after winning the toss

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair exercising with a pair of pale blue dumbbells.

props.synopsis: An online program aimed at improving diet, exercise and other modifiable risk factors for dementia has resulted in better cognition in older adults, Australian research has found.

title.children: Major Australian study finds lifestyle changes can delay cognitive decline

image.altText: A man with short hair and wearing a suit looks on from a press conference table.

props.synopsis: Sports federation Athletics Australia announces a rebrand to Australian Athletics in a move they say reflects the sport's evolution.

title.children: Athletics Australia becomes Australian Athletics in 'bold new' rebrand

image.altText: A burnt out car by the side of the road.

props.synopsis: A second burnt-out car is found by police in Melbourne's north, a day after the fatal shooting of Melbourne gangland figure Sam Abdulrahim.

title.children: Police hunting Melbourne underworld killers find second burnt-out car

image.altText: A graphic showing two warships next to each other. One is smaller.

props.synopsis: Tokyo is stepping up its campaign to win a lucrative Australian naval contract by pledging to give "priority" to warship exports over its own navy.

title.children: Japan vows to prioritise Australia over its own navy with new warships

image.altText: Kyiv missile

props.synopsis: The US president says he has good relationships with Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Vladimir Putin, but analysts say negotiating an end to the conflict is going to take much more than that.

title.children: 'Got a lot more leverage over Putin': Trump's path to end Ukraine war

image.altText: Caroline Kennedy press club

props.synopsis: Caroline Kennedy, the former US ambassador to Australia, has urged US senators to reject her cousin's bid to become health secretary.

title.children: Caroline Kennedy calls RFK Jr a predator ahead of confirmation hearing

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron gestures with his hands while standing in front of the Mona Lisa.

props.synopsis: Patrons at the world's most visited museum will be able to separately access its most famous work of art, Leonardo Da Vinci's Mona Lisa, following a six-year renovation announced by French President Emmanuel Macron.

title.children: Changes at Louvre to provide separate access to Mona Lisa

image.altText: A female teacher with red hair leans down to the desk of a primary-school student to help her with a question in class.

props.synopsis: Experts warn Australia's education system is "failing to deliver" for half a million kids and putting their future wellbeing at risk, but lessons from 2024 offer hope.

title.children: As Australian students underperform, one group is bucking the trend

image.altText: Hussein Chamas in cuffs on the floor of a boat, police behind him

props.synopsis: Federal police allege Hussein Chamas was arrested on a yacht off the Northern Territory coast that was headed towards Indonesia.

title.children: Fugitive allegedly boarded yacht off NT coast trying to flee country

image.altText: Dozens of bricks of drugs wrapped and laid out on a blue tarp

props.synopsis: Two young Victorian men who were involved in the attempted importation of more than 100 kilograms of cocaine into South Australia have been sentenced to three years in jail with a non-parole period of 18 months.

title.children: Pair labelled as 'muppets' jailed over attempted 'astronomical' cocaine import

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Sign in a florist saying "dear customer, cash only, no internet"

props.synopsis: For some brands, surviving PR disasters means facing a public backlash and trying to rebuild trust — a nearly impossible task once it's lost.

title.children: The recovery from PR blunders can be slow and costly

image.altText: A school photo of a teenaged boy

props.synopsis: Lachlan Cook, 16, died from a serious complication of type-1 diabetes following a school trip to Vietnam in 2019. The school he attended, Kilvington Grammar, has been fined $140,000.

title.children: Melbourne school fined $140k for student's death on overseas trip

image.altText: Whisky barrels in a row in the Nant distillery.

props.synopsis: After a criminal investigation was announced almost eight years ago, the man allegedly behind the Nant whisky investment scandal has faced court for the first time.

title.children: Man allegedly behind whisky investment scandal facing 736 charges

image.altText: A bird's eye view a house with a red roof between two homes with roofs in a lighter colour.

props.synopsis: A body corporate dispute over a red roof has been labelled a "surreal and ludicrous" waste of taxpayer money by Queensland's former body corporate commissioner.

title.children: Legal battle over red roof 'ludicrous' waste of money, says ex-commissioner

image.altText: A rider dressed in black attempts to hit a bike with a yellow L plate a two other riders ride beside the pair.

props.synopsis: A member of the Mongols bikie gang has been charged over two alleged incidents, including attempting to kick and punch a learner motorcycle rider as they travelled at high speed along a Melbourne freeway, police say.

title.children: Bikie member charged over alleged freeway kick in Melbourne

image.altText: A picnic blanket and camping chairs on a patch of grass surrounded by caravans

props.synopsis: Matt Andrew Dunn, 18, said he did not realise a car he attempted to steal was chained to a caravan with a family inside in the rural Queensland town of Hughenden.

title.children: Man sentenced for stealing car chained to caravan with family inside

image.altText: The Deepseek logo and the Chinese flag are seen in this illustration.

props.synopsis: DeepSeek appears to have debunked one of the tech world's holiest scriptures, but it may be too soon to believe the hype.

title.children: Beware the spin, but completely ignoring the DeepSeek hype would be a mistake

image.altText: A black and white photo of a woman sitting at a table with a book open, looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A controversial memoir of a Finnish woman who migrated to Stalin’s Soviet Russia in the 1930s and escaped in 1941. Ninety years later, her granddaughter has translated the diary into English.

title.children: Controversial diary became one of Finland's most banned books

image.altText: Sandy, greyish ball, being held in a leaf for protection, by a white hand

props.synopsis: An analysis of small grey balls that washed up on Sydney's Northern Beaches earlier this month found they were largely made of soap scum and cosmetics.

title.children: 'Fatty' balls found on Sydney beaches made of soap scum, faecal matter

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: It's alleged the woman poisoned her daughter and recorded her physical and emotional suffering to elicit donations, and is accused of defrauding donors of $60,000 via crowdfunding.

title.children: Influencer accused of drugging and torturing baby daughter granted bail

image.altText: DOnald Trump speaks to reporters before boarding Airforce One, January 2025

props.synopsis: A US judge temporarily blocks a Trump administration move to pause federal grants and loans while it conducts an across-the-board ideological review to uproot progressive initiatives.

title.children: US judge temporarily blocks Trump's order to pause federal grants and loans

image.altText: A man stands behind a microphone on a tennis court and looks up left into the stands.

props.synopsis: The protester who shouted at Alexander Zverev after the men's final of the Australian Open has revealed why she decided to make her stand at Melbourne Park.

title.children: 'I hope it happens everywhere': Tennis fan opens up about Zverev protest

image.altText: A close-up of a young white woman with dark hair, blue eyes and red lips

props.synopsis: The Stepford Wives meets Get Out in sci-fi thriller Companion, the debut feature film from Drew Hancock.

title.children: One man's doll-like new girlfriend seems too good to be true — she is

image.altText: An outstretched hand wearing a latex glove, holding two test tubes with blood in them.

props.synopsis: The federal government vows to ban life insurers from using genetic testing results to refuse cover or hike premiums, but advocates say delays to the policy are harming patients.

title.children: Impatience grows for promised genetic testing insurance ban

image.altText: A close up of Warren speaking at the National Press Club.

props.synopsis: Prominent anti-Voice campaigner Warren Mundine said there was "no doubt" the preselected Liberal candidate for the blue-ribbon Sydney seat of Bradfield was picked because she is a woman.

title.children: Prominent anti-Voice campaigner accused of 'disrespectful' comments

image.altText: A plan sits on the tarmac of an airport being doused by water from cranes after catching alight

props.synopsis: The incident comes in the wake of 179 people dying when a plane skidded off a runway at a different airport in the country last month.

title.children: Passenger plane catches fire at South Korean airport

image.altText: A suited arm points to a large sign with a clock at 11.58 and 'It is 2 minutes to Midnight' on it.

props.synopsis: The Doomsday Clock has been reset by scientists to 89 seconds to midnight - closer than ever before to global catastrophe

title.children: Doomsday Clock closer to midnight amid AI emergence and Russian nuclear threat

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and a woolen jumper sits at a table with a young child on her lap.

props.synopsis: The year Jodi sent her first child to school was the most difficult of her motherhood. Now she's learnt what works for her family.

title.children: Why my kids starting school was harder for me than them
